item.title: Linear Models for Clasification - The Perceptron Algorithm
item.description: 4.1.7 The Perceptron Algorithm In a perceptron algorithm, input vector $X$ is first transformed using a fixed nonlinear transformation to get a feature vector $\phi(X)$, and this is then used to construct a generalized linear model of the form $$\begin{align} y(X) = f(W^T\phi(X)) \end{align}$$ where the nonlinear activation function is given as $$\begin{align} f(a) = \begin{cases} +1, & a \geq 0\ -1, & a < 0 \end{cases} \end{align}$$ Here we will use a target coding scheme of ${-1,+1}$, where $t_n=+1$ for $C_1$ and $t_n=-1$ for $C_2$.
